article_text:
A wave of newly insured patients helped boost hospitals' earnings in recent months, two hospital operators said Friday, a sign the law's coverage expansion is leading more patients to seek treatment.

Universal Health Services Inc.'s revenue rose 10% for the second quarter compared with a year earlier. LifePoint Hospitals Inc.'s profit rose to $39.1 million for the quarter, a 44% increase compared with last year's quarter. Those...

article_metadata.author: Christopher Weaver
article_metadata.article.origheadline: Lifepoint Hospitals Profit Boosted From Health-Care Reform

article_summary:
A wave of newly insured patients helped boost hospitals' earnings in recent months, two hospital operators said Friday, a sign the law's coverage expansion is leading more patients to seek treatment.
LifePoint Hospitals Inc.'s profit rose to $39.1 million for the quarter, a 44% increase compared with last year's quarter.
Universal Health Services Inc.'s revenue rose 10% for the second quarter compared with a year earlier.
